comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A Mrs. Jane Brown was arrested at Gimbels in January 1914, according to the New York Times.  She was accused of trying to use a counterfeit $50 bill.  She told officers that she was born in San Francisco to English parents, and that she'd been in New York about nine months--but she also gave a fake address when asked.
